verses.verse: Then Eliphaz <S%H464><s%> the Temanite <S%H8489><s%> answered, <S%H6030><s%>

"If one ventures <S%H5254><s%> a word <S%H1697><s%> with you, will you become <S%H3811><s%> impatient <S%H3811><s%>? But who <S%H4310><s%> can <S%H3201><s%> refrain <S%H6113><s%> from speaking <S%H4405><s%>?
"Behold <S%H2009><s%> you have admonished <S%H3256><s%> many, <S%H7227><s%> And you have strengthened <S%H2388><s%> weak <S%H7504><s%> hands. <S%H3027><s%>
"Your words <S%H4405><s%> have helped the tottering <S%H3782><s%> to stand, <S%H6965><s%> And you have strengthened <S%H553><s%> feeble <S%H3766><s%> knees. <S%H1290><s%>
"But now <S%H6258><s%> it has come <S%H935><s%> to you, and you are impatient; <S%H3811><s%> It touches <S%H5060><s%> you, and you are dismayed. <S%H926><s%>
"Is not your fear <S%H3374><s%> [of God] your confidence, <S%H3690><s%> And the integrity <S%H8537><s%> of your ways <S%H1870><s%> your hope <S%H8615><s%>?
"Remember <S%H2142><s%> now, <S%H4994><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> [ever] perished being innocent <S%H6><s%>? Or where <S%H9345><s%> were the upright <S%H375><s%> destroyed <S%H3477><s%>?
"According to what <S%H834><s%> I have seen, <S%H7200><s%> those who plow <S%H9177><s%> iniquity <S%H205><s%> And those who sow <S%H2232><s%> trouble <S%H5999><s%> harvest <S%H7114><s%> it.
"By the breath <S%H5397><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> they perish, And by the blast <S%H6><s%> of His anger <S%H7307><s%> they come <S%H639><s%> to an end. <S%H3615><s%>

"The roaring <S%H7581><s%> of the lion <S%H9030><s%> and the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the [fierce] lion, <S%H7826><s%> And the teeth <S%H8127><s%> of the young <S%H3715><s%> lions <S%H3715><s%> are broken. <S%H5421><s%>
"The lion <S%H3918><s%> perishes for lack <S%H6><s%> of prey, <S%H1097><s%> And the whelps <S%H2964><s%> of the lioness <S%H1121><s%> are scattered. <S%H3833><s%>
"Now a word <S%H1697><s%> was brought <S%H1589><s%> to me stealthily, <S%H1589><s%> And my ear <S%H241><s%> received <S%H3947><s%> a whisper <S%H8102><s%> of it.
"Amid disquieting <S%H9620><s%> thoughts <S%H9620><s%> from the visions <S%H2384><s%> of the night, <S%H3915><s%> When deep <S%H8639><s%> sleep <S%H8639><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> on men, <S%H376><s%>
Dread <S%H6343><s%> came <S%H7122><s%> upon me, and trembling, <S%H9564><s%> And made all <S%H7230><s%> my bones <S%H6106><s%> shake. <S%H6342><s%>
"Then a spirit <S%H7307><s%> passed <S%H2498><s%> by my face; <S%H6440><s%> The hair <S%H8185><s%> of my flesh <S%H1320><s%> bristled <S%H5568><s%> up.

"It stood <S%H5975><s%> still, <S%H5975><s%> but I could not discern <S%H5234><s%> its appearance; <S%H4758><s%> A form <S%H8544><s%> [was] before <S%H5048><s%> my eyes; <S%H5869><s%> [There was] silence, <S%H1827><s%> then I heard <S%H8085><s%> a voice: <S%H6963><s%>
'Can mankind <S%H582><s%> be just <S%H6663><s%> before <S%H4480><s%> God <S%H433><s%>? Can a man <S%H1397><s%> be pure <S%H2891><s%> before <S%H4480><s%> his Maker <S%H6213><s%>?
'He puts <S%H539><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> trust <S%H539><s%> even <S%H2005><s%> in His servants; <S%H5650><s%> And against His angels <S%H4397><s%> He charges <S%H7760><s%> error. <S%H8417><s%>

'How <S%H637><s%> much <S%H637><s%> more <S%H637><s%> those who dwell <S%H7931><s%> in houses <S%H1004><s%> of clay, <S%H2563><s%> Whose <S%H834><s%> foundation <S%H3247><s%> is in the dust, <S%H6083><s%> Who are crushed <S%H1792><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the moth! <S%H6211><s%>
'Between <S%H4480><s%> morning <S%H1242><s%> and evening <S%H6153><s%> they are broken <S%H3807><s%> in pieces; <S%H3807><s%> Unobserved, <S%H1097><s%> <S%H7760><s%> they perish forever. <S%H6><s%>
'Is not their tent-cord plucked <S%H5265><s%> up within them? They die, <S%H4191><s%> yet without <S%H3808><s%> wisdom. <S%H2451><s%>'
